medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe ketotic hypoglycemia starting at the age of 14 months.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The twin who later developed ketotic hypoglycemia exhibited episodes of severe fatigue at 1 year of age, which occurred repeatedly without detectable hypoglycemia. A fasting tolerance test at 21 months showed hypoglycemia after 12 hours. At 5.5 years, he experienced hypoglycemia after a 15-hour fast. Symptoms such as fatigue, headache, and paleness occurred frequently, despite dietary counseling.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The affected twin had an episode of hypothermia without hypoglycemia during the neonatal period. No pathological organic aciduria or defects in fatty acid metabolism were found. No mutations were identified in the genes involved in ketone body metabolism.
medical_history.family_history: The parents are unrelated and healthy, with no family history of metabolic or endocrine disorders.
